metadata.title: CVE-2023-47233 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
The brcm80211 component in the Linux kernel through 6.5.10 has abrcmf_cfg80211_detach use-after-free in the device unplugging (disconnectthe USB by hotplug) code. For physically proximate attackers with localaccess, this "could be exploited in a real world scenario." This is relatedto brcmf_cfg80211_escan_timeout_worker indrivers/net/wireless/broadcom/brcm80211/brcmfmac/cfg80211.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-47233` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-254.288
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-254.288
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-254.288
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-225.237~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-225.237~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-225.237~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1132.142
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1169.184
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1168.181~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1177.192~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1162.179~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1131.142~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-254.288').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-225.237~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1132.142').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1169.184').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1168.181~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1177.192~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1162.179~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1131.142~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
